meanings.definition: To be bound or compelled to do something because of a sense of duty or moral responsibility.
meanings.sent1: I feel obligated to help my friend with their homework because I promised.
meanings.sent2: She is obligated to attend the meeting as part of her job responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was his turn to cook, he felt obligated to order takeout instead.
meanings.sent4: The hero felt obligated to save the town from the dragon's wrath.
meanings.sent5: The teacher felt obligated to stay late and help the struggling student understand the lesson.

meanings.definition: To be required or expected to do something because of a legal or moral obligation.
meanings.sent1: The company is obligated to pay its employees on time.
meanings.sent2: Students are obligated to follow the school's code of conduct.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt obligated to knock over the vase just to get attention.
meanings.sent4: The captain felt obligated to steer the ship away from the storm.
meanings.sent5: The doctor felt obligated to provide medical care to those in need.
